instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.PPBUS_G3H: What is PPBUS_G3H? Main system power rail that charges the battery, or is power from the battery, that everything else is powered from. .
definitions.PP3V3_G3H: What is PP3V3_G3H? PP3V3_G3H is a 3.3v power line that is present when the machine is in a Global System Hardware Off state, and should come on before most other rails so that the USB-C circuitry can be powered for the charger.
definitions.PP5V_S0: What is PP5V_S0? PP5V_S0 is a 5v power rail present when the system is in an S0 working state..
definitions.PP3V3_S0: What is PP3V3_S0? The "PP3V3_S0" rail in a MacBook logic board is a power rail that supplies 3.3 volts to the system when it is fully awake (S0 state). .
definitions.PM_SLP_S3_L: What is PM_SLP_S3_L? PM_SLP_S3_L puts the machine to sleep in an S3 state when it is asserted, the _L means it is asserted when it is low voltage. When this signal is 3.3v the machine will be asked to turn on S0 power rails and begin the bootup process.
definitions.PP1V8_S0: What is PP1V8_S0? PP1V8_S0 is a power rail that is present when the machine is in an S0 state, meaning it is fully turned on, not sleeping or hiberating .

threads.title: 00239-A 20v 0.36a No Display (LR364)
threads.message:
Came in with no display. Retrieved data through target disk mode. Extracted mobo with no visible signs of damage. Connected to monitor through usb, screen backlight comes on but nothing displayed (no apple logo).

L7210 0.725v
<SIGNAL>PP5V_S0</SIGNAL> 5.14v 0.426
<SIGNAL>PANEL_P5V_EN</SIGNAL> 0v 0.515
<SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> 13v 0.410
<SIGNAL>PP3V3_G3H</SIGNAL> 3.4V 0.325
<SIGNAL>PPVCCGT_CPU_PH3</SIGNAL> 0v
<SIGNAL>PPVCC_CPU_PH1</SIGNAL> 0v
<SIGNAL>PP1V8_S0</SIGNAL> 1.79v 0.308
<SIGNAL>PM_SLP_S3_L</SIGNAL> 3.35v 0.408
<SIGNAL>PP3V3_S0</SIGNAL> 3.34v 0.283

threads.title: 00239-A 20v 0.36a No Display (LR364)
threads.message: Check diode mode to ground on <SIGNAL>EDP_INT</SIGNAL> lines of J8500.

threads.title: 00239-A 20v 0.36a No Display (LR364)
threads.message:
I don't see big differences.
Just in case, compare with known good similar board.

CPU remains as first suspect here; bad iGPU.
